intro: Camissonia contorta var. pubens, commonly known as the hairy stem sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland habitats. Camissonia contorta var. pubens is adapted to arid environments and is often seen blooming in spring.
